name: Classic potato pancakes
method: Crush garlic in pestle and mortar (or press in to small bowl), than add warm water, olive oil and dill. Season with salt and pepper to taste, than set aside
Grate potatoes and onion thinly, drain excess liquid and stir in backing soda. Mix in all the rest of ingredients
Heat a large frying pan over high heat, add oil. Start forming thin pancakes, around 2 inches in diameter. Fry each side for 3 - 4 mins until golden
Drizzle with garlic sauce
Serve with extra garlic sauce and soured cream on the side

name: Macaroni po-flotski or navy style pasta
method: Bring a pot of water to boil, add salt and olive oil, cook pasta according to the package instructions

Heat a large frying pan over medium heat, add butter, garlic and shallots, cook until the onions are tender and slightly golden. Add mince, season with salt and pepper and mix with wooden spatula, braking meat in to small granules. Cooking until the edges of the pork are golden (5 - 8 min)
Add the flour and stir it well into the meat mixture until the flour is completely incorporated. Add the stock, bay leaf, cover and cook for further 3 minutes. Add the pasta, mix well
Garnish with parsley and black pepper to serve

name: Courgette and cheese bake
method: Preheat the oven 200C/fan 180C /gas 6
In the large ball mix all ingredients, excluding butter, together
Grease the baking pot, and fill it with the mixture. Bake on the middle shelf for 30 min until golden on the top
Garnish with parsley and black pepper to serve

name: Beef Pilau
method: Heat oil in a large frying pan, add meat. Fry over high heat turning occasionally until evenly golden. Transfer meat to a large pot
Add carrots and onions to the pot, mix. Cook for 10 min over medium heat occasionally stirring
Add stock, cumin, thyme, salt and barberries. Mix well than cover and continue cooking for another 30 min stirring every 10 min

Add 1/3 of the water and mix well, add rise and flatten it with spatula. Than place a small microwavable plate over the rice and pur the rest of the water over the plate slowly. Cover the pot and cook at low heat for 20 min until there is no more water left above the plate
Take out the plate, and push garlic bulb in to the rice. Switch off the heat, cover and live to rest for another 10 min
Add parsley and mix well. Serve with cooked garlic cloves and freshly grated black pepper

name: Bacon and cheese aubergine halves
method: Cut aubergines in half lengthways(s), lay on the board skin side up and make lengthways slits,  0.5cm wide, 1 cm from the stem. Transfer to the bowl and salt generously. Set aside for 10 min
Mix olive oil, crushed garlic and pinch of salt in the small bowl, set aside
Add cold water to the aubergines and leave for another 5 min. Drain well

Preheat the oven 200C/fan 180C /gas 6. Place aubergine halves skin side up on to greased baking dish, and start filling the slits with bacon, tomato and cheese slices. Spread infused olive oil sauce over aubergine skin, and bake for 20 min
Garnish with parsley and a drizzle of chilli oil. Serve hot or cold
